授業目的: The purpose of this course is to explore social, cultural and policy issues in education in Japan from a number of perspectives focusing generally on primary and secondary levels of formal schooling. In particular, we will consider how the Japanese education system constructs learning and the learner, as well as discuss the degree to which Japanese schools promote social inclusion, equity and meritocracy, and are sensitive to the needs of the increasing diversity of students attending them.
到達目標:
By the end of the course students should be able to:
1) Give an informed overview of the current education system and the recent educational reforms;
2) Critically analyze current debates on key issues such as academic achievement, gender, inclusiveness, social inequality and multicultural education;
3) At a deeper level, conceptually analyze the dynamics of the interaction between the policy, supply and demands sides of the education triangle and its outcomes.
授業方法: Face to face format. The class will consist of a short interactive lecture with group discussions.
